definition: to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)

sentences.english: Forget yesterday and aren't crazy for tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 忘记昨天，也不痴想明天。

sentences.english: He spends most of his time mooning over Helen.
sentences.chinese: 他大部分时间都在痴想着海伦。

sentences.english: Sense would resist delirium; judgments would warn passion.
sentences.chinese: 理智能抵御痴想，判断会告诫热情。

sentences.english: She spent hours mooning over her favourite actor.
sentences.chinese: 她一连好几个小时痴想她喜欢的那个男演员。

sentences.english: I now find myself in some of the wishful thinking.
sentences.chinese: 我发现现在自己都有些痴想了。

sentences.english: Forgetting yesterday neither will I think of tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 忘记昨天，也不要痴想明天。

sentences.english: Fogetting yesterday neither will I think of tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 忘记昨天，也不痴想明天。

definition: see 胡思亂想|胡思乱想[hu2 si1 luan4 xiang3]
to fancy from afar/reverie/wild and fanciful thoughts
(literary) to come in quick succession/wave after wave
to expect/to look forward to/anxious for sth/to hope (to get sth)
to yearn for sth day and night (idiom)
dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream
to stay together/to rely on one another
